messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Learning to Read and "Bored"
messages.msgSnippet: Robin , LOL! I could slap my self , I just had a V-8 moment!! I didn t scroll down from your ending and completely missed the nice list you took time to put
messages.messageBody:
Robin ,
LOL! I could slap my self , I just had a V-8 moment!! I didn't scroll down
from your ending and completely missed the nice list you took time to put
there. Sorry. Disregard that last e-mail. But I did enjoy your son's story.

Duh,
Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Learning to Read and "Bored"
messages.msgSnippet: Robin, Thats pretty funny about your son s reading!! Also I m interested about your I m bored list, it seems I hear those yucky words often. How is that
messages.messageBody:
Robin,
Thats pretty funny about your son's reading!! Also I'm interested about your
"I'm bored" list, it seems I hear those yucky words often. How is that
possible? I have no idea, as she has me exausted most of the time. LOL

Thanks
Tamie

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Learning to Read and "Bored"
messages.msgSnippet: My daughter used to tell me she was bored and I always said to her,  well, then that is your choice.  When you stop choosing to be bored, you will no longer
messages.messageBody:
My daughter used to tell me she was bored and I always said to her, " well,
then that is your choice. When you stop choosing to be bored, you will no
longer be bored." She never says that anymore.
